alert.note: Alert for Jemez Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 02 at 5:09AM MST until January 02 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...MOUNTAIN SNOW TO CONTINUE OVER WESTERN AND NORTHERN NEW MEXICO TODAY... .As a low pressure system crosses the Four Corners area and moves into Colorado, light to moderate snow will persist over western and central New Mexico today. Additional accumulations of 2 to 4 inches will be common in the mountains above 7,500 feet with locally higher amounts on higher peaks above 10,000 feet. Areas of reduced visibility and snow-packed roads will be possible. Snow will decrease in intensity this evening. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations up to 2 to 4 inches and locally up to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Jemez Mountains and Tusas Mountains Including Chama. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Jemez Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama
